subject: AI & Agents
title: The Black Box Problem
description: A 60-second lesson on The Black Box Problem.

hook.text: A loan application is denied. The bank says 'the algorithm decided.' Nobody can explain why.

buildup.text: Many AI models are black boxes ‚Äî they produce outputs but can't explain their reasoning.

discovery.text: Explainable AI (XAI) techniques try to reveal which factors most influenced a decision.

twist.text: Simpler models are more explainable but less accurate. There's a trade-off.

climax.text: Regulations now require explanations for automated decisions that affect people's lives.

punchline.text: If you can't explain it, should you deploy it?

quiz.question: What is the black box problem in AI?
options: Models produce decisions without explainable reasoning
Users can't see the computer running the model
